# Initialize BMad in Existing Project

## Purpose
Initialize the BMad framework in an existing brownfield project. Sets up necessary directory structure, configuration files, and workflow manifests.

## When to Use
Starting to use BMad methodology on an existing codebase.

## Related Agent
`@setup-bmad-master`

## What This Does
- Creates `_bmad/` directory structure
- Generates config files for each module (core, bmm, bmb, cis)
- Initializes workflow and task manifests
- Sets up user configuration (name, language, output folder)
- Creates initial project context template

## Expected Outcome
BMad framework fully configured and ready to use with existing project code.
